oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Plant gene bank collections - sources of variation in health substances
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Antonius, Kristiina
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Gene banks and national plant genetic resources programmes have been established to conserve genetic resources of domesticated plants. Variation of the beneficial health substances found in plants is the result of growing conditions (environment) and genes directing the growth (genotype).
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Antonius, Kristiina (2007) Plant gene bank collections - sources of variation in health substances. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 3 (1), p. 27.
